title: Chinese Government dispatches 11th medical team to El-Maarouf National Hospital Center, Fomboni Hospital, and Hombo Hospital
description: Since 1994, Guangxi Province has been sending medical teams to Comoros every two years. In 2016, the Chinese Government dispatched the 11th Chinese medical team to Comoros. The team was stationed at El-Maarouf National Hospital Center (Le Centre hospitalier national El-Maarouf) on the island of Grande Comore, Fomboni Hospital (L’hôpital de Fomboni or Centre Hospitalier de Fomboni) on the island of Mwali, and Hombo Hospital (L’hôpital Hombo) on the island of Anjouan. The 11-member team completed its term of service between November 24, 2016 and January 12, 2018. The members of the 11th medical team had specialized expertise in anesthesiology, gynecology, orthopedics, acupuncture, cardiology, surgery, and ophthalmology.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
Chinese Government dispatches 11th medical team to El-Maarouf National Hospital Center, Fomboni Hospital, and Hombo Hospital

# Description
Since 1994, Guangxi Province has been sending medical teams to Comoros every two years. In 2016, the Chinese Government dispatched the 11th Chinese medical team to Comoros. The team was stationed at El-Maarouf National Hospital Center (Le Centre hospitalier national El-Maarouf) on the island of Grande Comore, Fomboni Hospital (L’hôpital de Fomboni or Centre Hospitalier de Fomboni) on the island of Mwali, and Hombo Hospital (L’hôpital Hombo) on the island of Anjouan. The 11-member team completed its term of service between November 24, 2016 and January 12, 2018. The members of the 11th medical team had specialized expertise in anesthesiology, gynecology, orthopedics, acupuncture, cardiology, surgery, and ophthalmology.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare services without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Medical team deployment to hospitals, specialized healthcare services provided

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Mwali Island Digital Television Coverage Project
description: In 2016, China’s Ministry of Commerce provided a grant to the Government of Comoros for the Mwali Island Digital Television Coverage Project. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown. The purpose of this project was to expand digital terrestrial television coverage on the island of Mwali (Mohéli). China Radio and Television International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation (CRTV) was the contractor responsible for implementation.   The project was officially launched in May 2016. However, it actually began implementation on September 17, 2016. The project was completed and handed over to the local authorities on December 5, 2016.
staff_comments: 1. This project is also known as Phase 2 of the Digital Television Coverage Project.  Phase 1 sought to expand digital terrestrial television coverage in the Bambao region on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore). Phase 3 will seek to expand digital terrestrial television coverage on the island of Anjouan. Phase 4 will seek to expand digital terrestrial television coverage to the entire island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore). 2. The Chinese project title is 科莫埃利岛数字电视项目 or 科摩罗莫埃利岛数字电视覆盖项目 or 科摩罗广电落地及数字电视试点项目 or 莫埃利岛数字电视项目. The French project title is La diffusion en numérique terrestre de la station nationale.
combined_text:
# Sector
COMMUNICATIONS

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for Mwali Island Digital Television Coverage Project

# Description
In 2016, China’s Ministry of Commerce provided a grant to the Government of Comoros for the Mwali Island Digital Television Coverage Project. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown. The purpose of this project was to expand digital terrestrial television coverage on the island of Mwali (Mohéli). China Radio and Television International Economic and Technical Cooperation Corporation (CRTV) was the contractor responsible for implementation.   The project was officially launched in May 2016. However, it actually began implementation on September 17, 2016. The project was completed and handed over to the local authorities on December 5, 2016.
justification: Project focuses on digital television coverage expansion without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Digital terrestrial television coverage expansion, communications sector project

title: China donates 30 computers to the police stations of the National Police in Comoros
description: On December 1, 2016, the Chinese Ambassador to Comoros informed the president of Comoros that 30 computers had been donated to the police stations of the Comoros National Police. The cost of this donation is unclear.

title: China provides technical training course for 20 government officials from Comoros
description: On October 13, 2016, 20 Comorian government technicians departed Comoros for China where they participated in training courses designed to enhance their capabilities to successfully run a coal-fired power plant in Comoros. The training was organized and sponsored by North China Electrical Power University and the Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The training was completed on November 3, 2016.   It is unclear how much this training cost.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
China provides technical training course for 20 government officials from Comoros

# Description
On October 13, 2016, 20 Comorian government technicians departed Comoros for China where they participated in training courses designed to enhance their capabilities to successfully run a coal-fired power plant in Comoros. The training was organized and sponsored by North China Electrical Power University and the Chinese Ministry of Commerce. The training was completed on November 3, 2016.   It is unclear how much this training cost.
justification: Training specifically focused on operating coal-fired power plants, directly supporting fossil fuel infrastructure
evidence: Training for government technicians to run coal-fired power plant, organized by energy-focused university

title: Chinese Government provides RMB 28.9 million grant for Phase 2 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#73535, #57251, and #57255)
description: In 2010, China’s Ministry of Commerce provided a grant to the Government of Comoros for the Electricity Generator Acquisition Project. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown.   The project involved the provision of eight electricity generators with 10.6MW of power generation capacity: 4 generators (with 6MW of power generation capacity) for the Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore); 1 generator (with (with 3MW of power generation capacity) for the Wemani power plant in city of Fomboni on the island of Mohéli (Mwali); and 2 generators (with 3MW of power generation capacity) for the Trenani power plant on the island of Ndzuani (Anjouan).   The generators were successfully handed over to the Comorian authorities on August 5, 2010. The Chinese Government asked the Government of Comoros to pay for the cost of installing these generators, but they were unable to do so, which led to major delays in generator installation and use. China’s Ministry of Commerce subsequently agreed to provide a grant worth 200 million Comorian francs for the installation of the generators (through the so-called 'Electricity Generator Installation Project').   A contract with China Shenyang International Economic & Technical Cooperation corporation (CSYIC) was signed on September 29, 2012 to facilitate the implementation of the China Shenyang International Economic & Technical Cooperation Corporation (CSYIC). These generators were all successfully installed; however, the power plants where they were installed did not go into use until several years later. The Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant, Trenani power plant, and Wemani power plant were officially inaugurated on February 5, 2017, April 20, 2017, and May 4, 2017, respectively.   Then, in 2014, China’s Ministry of Commerce issued an RMB 29.25 million grant for the Phase 1 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project. The purpose of this project was to dispatch 6 engineers to maintain and operate Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore), the the Wemani power plant in city of Fomboni on the island of Mohéli (Mwali); and the Trenani power plant on the island of Ndzuani (Anjouan). CSYIC was the contractor responsible for implementation and it completed this project between 2014 and 2016.   Then on January 8, 2016 and January 14, 2016 the Chinese Government and the Government of Comoros signed letters of exchange for Phase 2 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce issued an RMB 28,970,103.80 grant for Phase 2. The purpose of Phase 2 was to dispatch technicians and engineers over a 3-year period to maintain and operate Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore), the the Wemani power plant in city of Fomboni on the island of Mohéli (Mwali); and the Trenani power plant on the island of Ndzuani (Anjouan).    Phase 2 also involved the provision of spare parts and equipment needed for repairs. CSYIC was the contractor responsible for implementation. One official source from 2018 indicates that Phase 2 was ongoing. However, precise Phase 2 implementation start end dates are unknown.    The Electricity Generator Acquisition Project is captured via Project ID#57255. The Electricity Generator Installation Project is captured via Project ID#57251). Phase 1 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project is captured via Project ID#73535.  Phase 2 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project is captured via Project ID#57412.
staff_comments: 1. The Chinese project title is 火电厂技术合作项目（第二期). The French project title is La 2e phase du project d'assistance technique pour la maintenance de groups électrogènes.
combined_text:
# Sector
ENERGY

# Title
Chinese Government provides RMB 28.9 million grant for Phase 2 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project (Linked to Project ID#73535, #57251, and #57255)

# Description
In 2010, China’s Ministry of Commerce provided a grant to the Government of Comoros for the Electricity Generator Acquisition Project. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown.   The project involved the provision of eight electricity generators with 10.6MW of power generation capacity: 4 generators (with 6MW of power generation capacity) for the Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore); 1 generator (with (with 3MW of power generation capacity) for the Wemani power plant in city of Fomboni on the island of Mohéli (Mwali); and 2 generators (with 3MW of power generation capacity) for the Trenani power plant on the island of Ndzuani (Anjouan).   The generators were successfully handed over to the Comorian authorities on August 5, 2010. The Chinese Government asked the Government of Comoros to pay for the cost of installing these generators, but they were unable to do so, which led to major delays in generator installation and use. China’s Ministry of Commerce subsequently agreed to provide a grant worth 200 million Comorian francs for the installation of the generators (through the so-called 'Electricity Generator Installation Project').   A contract with China Shenyang International Economic & Technical Cooperation corporation (CSYIC) was signed on September 29, 2012 to facilitate the implementation of the China Shenyang International Economic & Technical Cooperation Corporation (CSYIC). These generators were all successfully installed; however, the power plants where they were installed did not go into use until several years later. The Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant, Trenani power plant, and Wemani power plant were officially inaugurated on February 5, 2017, April 20, 2017, and May 4, 2017, respectively.   Then, in 2014, China’s Ministry of Commerce issued an RMB 29.25 million grant for the Phase 1 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project. The purpose of this project was to dispatch 6 engineers to maintain and operate Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore), the the Wemani power plant in city of Fomboni on the island of Mohéli (Mwali); and the Trenani power plant on the island of Ndzuani (Anjouan). CSYIC was the contractor responsible for implementation and it completed this project between 2014 and 2016.   Then on January 8, 2016 and January 14, 2016 the Chinese Government and the Government of Comoros signed letters of exchange for Phase 2 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project. China’s Ministry of Commerce issued an RMB 28,970,103.80 grant for Phase 2. The purpose of Phase 2 was to dispatch technicians and engineers over a 3-year period to maintain and operate Voidjou (Vwadju) power plant on the island of Ngazidja (Grande Comore), the the Wemani power plant in city of Fomboni on the island of Mohéli (Mwali); and the Trenani power plant on the island of Ndzuani (Anjouan).    Phase 2 also involved the provision of spare parts and equipment needed for repairs. CSYIC was the contractor responsible for implementation. One official source from 2018 indicates that Phase 2 was ongoing. However, precise Phase 2 implementation start end dates are unknown.    The Electricity Generator Acquisition Project is captured via Project ID#57255. The Electricity Generator Installation Project is captured via Project ID#57251). Phase 1 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project is captured via Project ID#73535.  Phase 2 of Power Plant Technical Cooperation Project is captured via Project ID#57412.
justification: Project focuses on maintenance and operation of existing power plants, which likely include fossil fuel generators, but also supports grid stability and energy access
evidence: Technical cooperation for power plant maintenance, provision of spare parts and equipment, focus on existing power plants with generators

title: China and Huawei donate computers and other equipment to Comoros secondary schools
description: On January 14, 2016, the ambassador of China and the Huawei Technologies Co. representative in Comoros donated a tablet to the President of Comoros's wife. Additionally, Huawei pledged to fund her charity which provides teaching equipment to local secondary schools. The exact amount of donation to the schools is unknown.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China and Huawei donate computers and other equipment to Comoros secondary schools

# Description
On January 14, 2016, the ambassador of China and the Huawei Technologies Co. representative in Comoros donated a tablet to the President of Comoros's wife. Additionally, Huawei pledged to fund her charity which provides teaching equipment to local secondary schools. The exact amount of donation to the schools is unknown.
justification: Project focuses on education and technology donation without clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Donation of computers and equipment to secondary schools, focus on education sector

title: China Gives Congo Medical Equipment worth 620 Million FCFA
description: In 2016, Chinese Ambassador to Republic of Congo gave the Congolese government a batch of medical equipment worth 620 million FCFA, intended to equip the ophthalmic departments of hospitals. This donation is apart of a larger operation titled "opération lumière", a campaign for free screening and treatment for cataracts in Congo.
combined_text:
# Sector
HEALTH

# Title
China Gives Congo Medical Equipment worth 620 Million FCFA

# Description
In 2016, Chinese Ambassador to Republic of Congo gave the Congolese government a batch of medical equipment worth 620 million FCFA, intended to equip the ophthalmic departments of hospitals. This donation is apart of a larger operation titled "opération lumière", a campaign for free screening and treatment for cataracts in Congo.
justification: Project is focused on healthcare equipment donation without direct environmental or energy transition implications
evidence: Medical equipment donation for ophthalmic departments, part of healthcare initiative

title: China Embassy provides $70,000 grant for Odzala-Kokoua National Park (Linked to Project ID#41526)
description: In January 2016, the Chinese Embassy in Republic of Congo donated USD 70,000 to the Odzala-Kokoua National Park. The funds were disbursed and will be used for the repair and maintenance of 42 kilometers of road in the park. The roads are used by Odzala eco-guard units to implement anti-poaching initiatives in the park, and also provide access to the park for tourists.   A paper from the Central China Normal University lists the park as Odzala-Nkokouain and reports two donations of USD 100,000 and USD 70,000. The agreement to donate USD 100,000 for the park was signed in 2014 (described in #41526).
combined_text:
# Sector
GENERAL ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION

# Title
China Embassy provides $70,000 grant for Odzala-Kokoua National Park (Linked to Project ID#41526)

# Description
In January 2016, the Chinese Embassy in Republic of Congo donated USD 70,000 to the Odzala-Kokoua National Park. The funds were disbursed and will be used for the repair and maintenance of 42 kilometers of road in the park. The roads are used by Odzala eco-guard units to implement anti-poaching initiatives in the park, and also provide access to the park for tourists.   A paper from the Central China Normal University lists the park as Odzala-Nkokouain and reports two donations of USD 100,000 and USD 70,000. The agreement to donate USD 100,000 for the park was signed in 2014 (described in #41526).
justification: Project focuses on road maintenance for environmental protection and tourism access, with no direct energy transition impact
evidence: Funds used for repair and maintenance of 42km of road in national park, supporting anti-poaching initiatives and tourism access

title: China Funds Congolese Scholarships to China in 2016-2017 academic year
description: On August 26, 2016, Congo (Brazzaville), Ambassador Xia Huang held in the embassy a farewell reception to send off military cadets and students to study and train in China for the 2016-2017 academic year. The recipients include military cadets, students on scholarship from the Chinese government or the Confucius Institute.   When President Sassou visited China in July 2016, President Xi Jinping announced that in order to help the Congo with economic and social development, the Chinese side decided to provide more scholarships to the government, from 230 to 300 per year .
staff_comments: specific number of students unclear. stage 2 research needed.
combined_text:
# Sector
EDUCATION

# Title
China Funds Congolese Scholarships to China in 2016-2017 academic year

# Description
On August 26, 2016, Congo (Brazzaville), Ambassador Xia Huang held in the embassy a farewell reception to send off military cadets and students to study and train in China for the 2016-2017 academic year. The recipients include military cadets, students on scholarship from the Chinese government or the Confucius Institute.   When President Sassou visited China in July 2016, President Xi Jinping announced that in order to help the Congo with economic and social development, the Chinese side decided to provide more scholarships to the government, from 230 to 300 per year .
justification: Project focuses on educational scholarships without direct environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Scholarships for military cadets and students, focus on education and training

title: Chinese Government provides grant for Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital Access Road Rehabilitation Project (Linked to Project ID#30201)
description: In 2016, the Chinese Government provided a grant to the Republic of Congo for the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital Access Road Rehabilitation Project. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown. The project involved the rehabilitation of an access road that leads to the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou or 中刚友好医院) in M’Filou, which is located in the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville.   China State Construction Engineering Corporation Ltd. (CSCEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. On December 21, 2016, a project completion ceremony took place. In 2009, the Chinese Government also provided an RMB 70 million grant for the construction of this hospital (captured in Project ID#30201).
staff_comments: The French project title is rehabilitation of de la voie d’acces a l'Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise. The Chinese project title is 中刚友好医院道路修缮项目.
combined_text:
# Sector
TRANSPORT AND STORAGE

# Title
Chinese Government provides grant for Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital Access Road Rehabilitation Project (Linked to Project ID#30201)

# Description
In 2016, the Chinese Government provided a grant to the Republic of Congo for the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital Access Road Rehabilitation Project. The monetary value of this grant commitment is unknown. The project involved the rehabilitation of an access road that leads to the Sino-Congolese Friendship Hospital (or Hôpital d'amitié sino-congolaise de M’Filou or l'Hôpital de base de Mfilou or 中刚友好医院) in M’Filou, which is located in the 7th arrondissement of the capital city of Brazzaville.   China State Construction Engineering Corporation Ltd. (CSCEC) was the contractor responsible for project implementation. On December 21, 2016, a project completion ceremony took place. In 2009, the Chinese Government also provided an RMB 70 million grant for the construction of this hospital (captured in Project ID#30201).
justification: Project involves road rehabilitation for hospital access, with no clear environmental or energy transition impacts
evidence: Rehabilitation of access road to hospital, general infrastructure project
